intro: Malaxis brevicaulis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved malaxis, is a terrestrial orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, dark green leaves. The plant produces intricate, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-yellow with reddish markings. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and orchid enthusiasts.
